H0.text: Cell division is the process used for cell growth, repair of cuts, and replacement of wornâ€‘out cells.

H1.text: Reproduction is the process used for cell growth, repair of cuts, and replacement of worn out cells.

H2.text: Binary fission is the process used for cell growth, repair of cuts and replacement of worn out cells.

H3.text: Pollination is the process used for cell growth, repair of cuts, and replacement of worn out cells.

A4.text: Multicellular organisms replace worn-out cells through cell division.

A5.text: Mitotic cell division can create progeny from multicellular organisms, such as plants that grow from cuttings.
